data.title: 78: Moving to New York (part 2)
data.description:

data.description:

data.title: 68: My thoughts on copying code
data.description:
Copying and pasting code is something that every developer does, but there is a misconception around not being a "real developer" by doing so. Also, if you do copy code, what's the best way to do it to keep proper maintainability of your codebase? I provide my thoughts on everything in this episode!

data.title: 54: Microsoft acquires GitHub
data.description:
Microsoft recently acquired GitHub, an open source software platform, for $7.5 billion. With lots of developers "freaking out", I wanted to share my opinion on why I don't think this acquisition is necessarily a bad thing.

Video version: https://youtu.be/ggTDiWNvoss

Episode Links:

data.title: 47: State management in UI
data.description:
Talking about two different ways of managing state in a user interface. The traditional imperative way, and the new declarative way.

This is helpful in learning modern JavaScript frameworks like React, Vue, and Angular.

Like the episode? Tweet me your feedback and other topic suggestions @sunnysinghio and subscribe to the podcast on Apple Podcasts or Google Play.

data.title: 46: Componetize everything
data.description:
Talking about components, and the concept of componetizing everything. What problems do components solve in design and code, and what popularized them?

Tweet me feedback and topic suggestions @sunnysinghio.

data.title: 45: My CES trip to Vegas
data.description:
I went to the CES tech conference this year. I explain what it is, why I went, and what I saw.

Check out Digital Bounds: http://digitalbounds.com
My YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/SunnySinghTV

data.title: 44: Evergreen content
data.description: What is evergreen content and how can it benefit you?

data.title: 43: Goodbye 2017
data.description:
An update episode. Thanking everyone that listened, and I also share my goals in personal branding.

Subscribe to my YouTube: http://youtube.com/SunnySinghTV

data.title: 42: Net neutrality
data.description:
Talking about the recent repeal of net neutrality. What is it, and how does this affect how we use and build for the Internet?

Tweet me what you think @sunnysinghio.

data.title: 41: Crypto and blockchain
data.description: Let's learn together about cryptocurrency and blockchain. I share my experience in making a profit off Litecoin.

data.title: 40: Cross-browser development
data.description:
Responding to some call-ins today. Talking about some tools that can help.with Cross-browser development.

Check out these stations/podcasts who called in:
- https://anchor.fm/anchortalk
- https://anchor.fm/patrick-sweetman

Links from this episode:
- https://autoprefixer.github.io/
- https://babeljs.io/
- http://getbootstrap.com/
- https://polyfill.io/v2/docs/

Tweet me @sunnysinghio for topic suggestions and feedback. Call-in or leave comments by downloading the Anchor app and searching Sunny Commutes.

data.title: 39: Build for all browsers
data.description:
A PSA on why you shouldn't just optimize for Google Chrome.

Article from TNW: https://thenextweb.com/dd/2017/11/28/please-build-websites-web-not-just-google-chrome/

data.title: 38: Releases
data.description:
Three tips that help you release software smoothly.

Tweet me feedback and new topics: @sunnysinghio or @sunnycommutes

data.title: 37: Giving thanks
data.description: In honor of this upcoming Thanksgiving, I give thanks to some of the things that have happened and the people that helped me. I'll get back to regular episodes after i recover from this cold. Let me know what you're thankful for @sunnysinghio on Twitter.

data.title: 36: Featured on Product Hunt!
data.description:
We just launched a new product at Ninjality, and it was featured on Product Hunt today! It's a search engine for brands where you can easily find colors, style guides, and logos.

Site: https://brand.sh
Twitter: https://twitter.com/branddotsh
Product Hunt: https://www.producthunt.com/posts/brandsearch

Tweet me feedback @sunnysinghio

data.title: 35: What makes a good UI?
data.description: I share my small list of things that I follow when building a UI. Tweet me @sunnysinghio for your suggestions.

data.title: 34: No pre-roll ads!
data.description: I'm late on the news, but apparently Anchor has removed pre-roll ads! I talk about why I think it's important and the story of how I came to know. Tweet me @sunnysinghio

data.title: 33: Value in HTML/CSS
data.description: Is there value in people that only know how you write HTML and CSS? Should you look for JavaScript developers? Some of my thoughts on this topic in this episode. Tweet me @sunnysinghio

data.title: 32: Question everything
data.description: Quick spurt of thoughts about why you should question even when talking to experts.

data.title: 31: Accessibility in depth
data.description: Daily implementation tips for web accessibility. Tweet me suggestions at @sunnysinghio

data.title: 30: Web accessibility
data.description: Talking about accessibility on the web. Mistake on the URL, it's http://a11yproject.com. Tweet me @sunnysinghio and call in on the Anchor app.

data.title: 29: üçÅFall
data.description: I love the fall season! Some updates and what I'll be doing.

data.description: Talking about CloudFlare's announcement of DDoS protection for all users.

data.description: A project of mine that I dogfood daily. Tweet me @sunnysinghio for feedback and topic suggestions.

data.description: Talking about the BSD+Patents license.

data.description: I rant about annoying marketing schemes.

data.description: Talking about how to deal with when technical effort is underestimated. Thanks to Marcus Blankenship for the great article.

data.description: My thoughts on frontend frameworks.

data.description: I talk about some benefits to blogging for your business.

data.title: Domain names
data.description: When should you purchase a domain name? A .com or vanity? What's the best place to buy them? I answer these in this episode.

data.description: How having knowledge and experience in other roles can help your own.

data.description: I follow-up my episode on imposter syndrome by featuring some comments and call-ins. Tweet me new topics @sunnysinghio

data.description: Small talk on imposter syndrome.

data.title: Static websites
data.description: What are static websites and the benefits of them versus dynamic websites? I answer these questions and more on this episode.
